meanings.definition: To take back or regain possession of something.
meanings.sent1: She reassumes her lost toy from the playground.
meanings.sent2: He reassumes his jacket after forgetting it at the restaurant.
meanings.sent3: The cat reassumes its favorite spot on the windowsill after being shooed away.
meanings.sent4: The sun reassumes its place in the sky after a brief cloud cover.
meanings.sent5: The student reassumes his pencil to continue writing his assignment.

meanings.definition: To resume a previous position or role.
meanings.sent1: After a break, she reassumes her role as the team captain.
meanings.sent2: He reassumes his duties as the manager after his vacation.
meanings.sent3: The actor reassumes his character on stage after a quick costume change.
meanings.sent4: The leader reassumes control of the meeting after a brief interruption.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reassumes her position at the front of the class to start the lesson.
